Eligibility: 18 years of age or older with informed written consent
• Planned for a modified radical mastectomy
- Class of Surgery Injury Class I/Clean using the CDC SSI Surgical Wound Classification
Unable to give consent and unlikely to comply with the requirements of the study and complete the 90-day follow-up visit

Current surgery for a radical modified mastectomy with immediate breast reconstruction, cosmetic breast operations, reduction, expansion, insertion of prostheses, canal ectasia or infectious breast disease or implant
• Surgery injuries classified in classes II, III or IV according to the classification of SSI CDC surgical injuries
Has experienced an allergy or intolerance to triclosan
has compromised wound healing or chronic immune deficiency, e.g. diabetes, prolonged steroid use, AIDS or substance abuse
A serious heart and/or lung disease
Has a history of skin scars or family history
· Has a direct connection with or participation in this study or other studies under the direction of the investigator or centre
Has received a drug or an experimental device within 30 days of the expected start of treatment
Results: Average score on the visual analogue scale of cosmetic results (VAS)

The post-operative cosmetic results evaluated on surgical site photographs by an independent blinded central assessor using a validated 100 mm visual analog scale, with 0 representing the worst possible scar and 100 representing the best possible scar
